column4: hey folks, i'm losing my mind. I'm trying to get a pixmap gtk2 theme working and i can't get any apps to use it. I've coped the theme to /usr/share/themes and the gtkrc file to ~/  What else would i have to do. (note, i'm not using gnome, i just want some matching gtk apps in kde)
that's not how you do it
oh? Teach me oh wise one :")
first of all, I believe kde has support for setting the gtk theme
if it doesn't, you can use switch2 from the gtk-theme-switch package, which writes gtk-theme-name to ~/.gtkrc-2.0
well the idea is that soon i will be using neither kde or gnome.
also, you can put themes in ~/.themes/ instead of doing it systemwide
right, but i'd rather it were system wide
what would the manual option be? i dont have gtk-theme-switch avail.
you don't have a gtk-theme-switch package in the repos?
i'm not a ubuntu user, i'm using sourcemage
finally someone who uses gtk stuff :")
i think i just figured it out
thanks. I'll check there next. I appreciate the help
